programme.sub-title: The Heart of a Pit Bull

programme.desc: A dog with a rare disease needs life-saving surgery - an operation Dr Jeff has never performed before. The vets also treat a cat with a mysterious injury

programme.title: Pit Bulls and Parolees
programme.desc: The rescue centres oldest resident, a pit bull with severe arthritis, is rehomed. Earl works to improve a dogs social skills and Kananis girlfriend takes on her first rescue

programme.title: Flying Wild Alaska
programme.desc: The crew of Era Alaska provide aid to a village devastated by flooding. Two pilots get lost off the Russian coast while delivering ammunition, and Jims Cessna 180 goes up in smoke

programme.title: Flying Wild Alaska
programme.desc: Ariel takes to the skies in a new plane - with dangerous results. Meanwhile, lead pilot Erik Snuggerud battles heavy turbulence as he transports a special delivery

programme.title: Treehouse Masters
programme.desc: Pete Nelson revisits two builds in need of major makeovers, setting about reconstructing and revitalising this pair of treehouses to bring them back to their former glory

programme.title: Bad Dog!
programme.desc: A dog that keeps chasing an ice-cream van, a cat that steals food and destroys its owners house, and a rabbit that keeps wreaking havoc in the fridge

programme.title: How Do Animals Do That?
programme.desc: More secrets from the animal kingdom, including why moths are attracted to flames, why turtles cry and why sea otters bond with stones

programme.title: How Do Animals Do That?
programme.desc: Experts spill the secrets of the animal kingdom, revealing why spiders dont get stuck in their own webs and how foxes find water in the desert

programme.title: Little Giants
programme.desc: The team is in Madagascar to study the recently discovered Goodmans mouse lemur. One of the worlds smallest primates, it is incredible agile and ferocious

programme.title: Little Giants

programme.title: Tanked
programme.desc: Director Kevin Smith, one half of Hollywood comedy duo Jay and Silent Bob, seeks a new home for two turtles and a tortoise, giving Brett and Wayde a new, challenging job

programme.title: Life After: Chernobyl
programme.desc: Scientists with unlimited access to the Chernobyl danger zone explore how the environment and wildlife are affected after 30 years in the most contaminated area on earth

programme.title: Fish or Die
programme.desc: In Mexico, the crew navigate a maze of crocodile and mosquito-infested waterways and lagoons in search of a rumoured paradise for fishing tarpon

programme.title: Saved by the Barn

programme.desc: As the siblings race to finish their water system, Billy gets news that shakes the Wolfpack. Bear goes hunting and reflects on a big life decision

programme.title: Flying Wild Alaska
programme.desc: John Dronenberg and Justin Essian transport propane to a fishing lodge, while Luke Hickerson struggles with failing equipment and Ponts challenges Ariel to make the perfect landing

programme.title: Flying Wild Alaska
programme.desc: Sarah makes her first flight in a 208, Ariel hunts for seagull eggs and Erik tries to keep his aircraft in the sky over one of Alaskas most notorious runways

programme.title: Lone Star Law
programme.desc: Documentary following the Texan wardens as deer poacher is busted, a baby rattlesnake is rescued, a hummingbird evades capture and a raccoon is released back into the wild

programme.title: Dr Jeff: Rocky Mountain Vet
programme.desc: Dr Jeff discovers a life-threatening problem in a Great Dane, while Dr Don battles to save the leg of a cat that has been attacked by a mystery animal at night

programme.title: Treehouse Masters
programme.desc: Pete Nelson and the crew revive the Treehouse Workshop, building the perfect retreat for a group of young carpenters from Sawhorse Revolution

programme.title: Expedition Bigfoot
programme.desc: Russell records thermal imagery that believes is Bigfoot. Mireya and Ronny have a terrifying experience when they realise they are not alone in the forest

programme.title: Alaska: The Last Frontier
programme.sub-title: The Day the Homestead Almost Died
programme.desc: Determined survivalists the Kilchers return, and with the family legacy at risk, they work to revamp the homestead. However, a huge snowstorm threatens their work

programme.title: Alaskan Bush People
programme.desc: When the ranch comes under fire from encroaching hunters, Gabe decides to learn to ride a horse as the family constructs a fence around the property

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Freak weather hits Texas and the team fights to save eight horses swimming in a flooded pasture, with one suffering potentially fatal wounds

programme.title: Around the World in 80 Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don takes his global tour to the US to investigate whether the worlds most powerful nation expresses its wealth through its beauty spots. In New York he meets a group of garden guerrillas transforming derelict land into community oases. In Virginia, he visits a conservation project that details Americas history, and in California he searches for plots that reflect the glamour of Hollywood

programme.title: Pavarotti Masterclass
programme.desc: A 1987 programme in which Italian stenor Luciano Pavarotti acts as coach to four young singers, giving them a short masterclass in the skills he has learnt from a life in opera

programme.title: Strauss: The Waltz King
programme.desc: A 2005 drama-documentary narrated by soprano Lesley Garrett, exploring composer Johann Strauss IIs music and looking at his turbulent family life. Despite success in his home town of Vienna and abroad, Strauss felt overshadowed by his father, who had originally popularised the waltz in the city. Simon Williams stars as Johann Strauss II, with Joe Duttine and Alexandra Gilbreath also among the cast

programme.title: Reputations
programme.sub-title: Dr Martin Luther King - Days of Hope
programme.desc: A 1997 profile of Martin Luther King Jr, immortalised as one of the great champions of civil rights and non-violent protest. Drawing on interviews with the people he knew, this film reveals that King was never comfortable with the praise he received and was often tormented by self-doubt

programme.title: Face to Face
programme.desc: A 1961 interview in which the civil rights activist talks to John Freeman about his childhood experiences and the incidents that led to the Montgomery bus boycott, events that shaped Kings life and led to him becoming a national figurehead and civil rights leader

programme.title: Timeshift
programme.sub-title: Bridging the Gap: How the Severn Bridge Was Built
programme.desc: Liz Bonnin marks the 50th anniversary of the construction of the Severn Bridge in a Timeshift special telling the inside story of its design and construction. As the motorway link between England and Wales, the Severn Bridge was described as the most perfect suspension bridge in the world, and Liz reveals how its unique, slim-line structure came about by accident

programme.title: Munro: Mountain Man
programme.desc: The story of Victorian adventurer Hugh Munro and his determination to list and climb all the Scottish mountains whose height exceeds 3,000ft. Nicholas Crane visits some of the countrys spectacular mountains as he explores the adventurers bid to reach more than 500 peaks and reveals how his name has been adopted by climbing enthusiasts pursuing the same goal, a pastime known as Munro bagging

programme.title: Strauss: The Waltz King
programme.desc: A 2005 drama-documentary narrated by soprano Lesley Garrett, exploring composer Johann Strauss IIs music and looking at his turbulent family life. Despite success in his home town of Vienna and abroad, Strauss felt overshadowed by his father, who had originally popularised the waltz in the city. Simon Williams stars as Johann Strauss II, with Joe Duttine and Alexandra Gilbreath also among the cast

programme.title: Around the World in 80 Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don takes his global tour to the US to investigate whether the worlds most powerful nation expresses its wealth through its beauty spots. In New York he meets a group of garden guerrillas transforming derelict land into community oases. In Virginia, he visits a conservation project that details Americas history, and in California he searches for plots that reflect the glamour of Hollywood

programme.title: Fred Dibnahs Building of Britain
programme.desc: Turning his attentions to timber structures from the Middle Ages the former steeplejack visits Englands oldest fortified building with a moat, Stokesay Castle. He also journeys to Harvington Hall near Kidderminster, Worcestershire, to see how bricks became an important part of timber-framed houses

programme.title: The Channel Tunnel - Life on the Inside
programme.desc: Documentary that goes behind the scenes of the Channel Tunnel, meeting the people above and below ground who keep everything moving through the longest undersea tunnel in the world. The Eurotunnel teams at both ends are on a mission to keep everything on track getting dog owners home after Crufts, keeping trucks moving despite strikes at French customs and making sure the trains keep circulating, no matter what

programme.title: An Art Lovers Guide
programme.desc: Janina Ramirez and Alastair Sooke discover the art and architecture of Barcelona, seeking out the Romanesque frescoes that inspired a young Miro and the designs of an engineer who arguably put more of a stamp on the city than its star architect, Antoni Gaudí

programme.title: Henry VIII: Patron or Plunderer?
programme.desc: Part two of two. Historian Jonathan Foyle explores how the kings choices in art and architecture provide clues to his mental state in the 1530s. Following the monarchs break from Rome, divorce from Catherine of Aragon and subsequent marriage to Anne Boleyn in the hope of finally fathering an heir, his desperation for a new image was at its peak

programme.title: The Sky at Night
programme.desc: The team delves into the world of astronaut training, discovering what it takes to become a European Space Agency astronaut. As Europe looks to play a more prominent role in space exploration, the programme shines a spotlight on candidates pushing boundaries and preparing to represent Great Britain and Northern Ireland amongst the stars. Helen Sharman, the first British astronaut, joins Chris Lintott at the Science Museum to celebrate the opening of the new space gallery

programme.title: Professor Angie Hobbs Remembers - The Great Philosophers
programme.desc: The philosopher and academic gives a modern take on Bryan Magees highly influential 1987 series about the history of western philosophy. She examines its approach and ideas and the thinking that it explored, explaining how it inspired her and many others to explore philosophy when it was first broadcast

programme.title: The Great Philosophers
programme.desc: A 1987 series in which Bryan Magee presented a history of western philosophy. In the first edition, he is joined by Myles Burnyeat to look at the works of Plato, universally recognised as the first western philosopher whose written works survived

programme.title: The Great Philosophers
programme.desc: Bryan Magee is joined by Martha Nussbaum to explore the ideas and principles of Greek philosopher Aristotle, whose work dominated western thought for many hundreds of years

programme.title: The Great Philosophers
programme.desc: Bryan Magee is joined by Anthony Kenny to look at medieval philosophers and the contribution of figures such as St Augustine and Thomas Aquinas

programme.title: Fred Dibnahs Building of Britain
programme.desc: Turning his attentions to timber structures from the Middle Ages the former steeplejack visits Englands oldest fortified building with a moat, Stokesay Castle. He also journeys to Harvington Hall near Kidderminster, Worcestershire, to see how bricks became an important part of timber-framed houses

programme.title: The Channel Tunnel - Life on the Inside
programme.desc: Documentary that goes behind the scenes of the Channel Tunnel, meeting the people above and below ground who keep everything moving through the longest undersea tunnel in the world. The Eurotunnel teams at both ends are on a mission to keep everything on track getting dog owners home after Crufts, keeping trucks moving despite strikes at French customs and making sure the trains keep circulating, no matter what

programme.desc: Janina Ramirez and Alastair Sooke discover the art and architecture of Barcelona, seeking out the Romanesque frescoes that inspired a young Miro and the designs of an engineer who arguably put more of a stamp on the city than its star architect, Antoni Gaudí

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Sunday with Laura Kuenssberg
programme.desc: Interviews with key politicians and public figures

programme.title: Sunday Politics Northern Ireland
programme.desc: Mark Carruthers looks at the political developments of the week and questions policy-makers on the key issues

programme.title: Sunday Morning Live
programme.desc: Sean Fletcher and Mehreen Baig host the topical debate covering religious, moral and ethical issues, with guest panellists and contributions from viewers

programme.title: Prayer and Reflection
programme.desc: A daily morning service from Guru Nanak Darbar Gurdwara Sikh temple in Gravesend, Kent, including the culmination of the Akhand Path, a 48-hour continuous prayer. Featuring a core element of Sikhism called Sewa, or selfless service, in which volunteer prepare food for the congregation throughout the course of the day

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Roo Irvine presents from Oswestry, Shropshire, and discovers a collection of miniature outfits tracing fashion over the last 1000 years. With Danny Sebastian and Colin Young

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: Songs of Praise
programme.sub-title: Young Chorister of the Year - Final
programme.desc: Aled Jones and the Rev Kate Bottley host the final of BBC Young Chorister of the Year from Halle St Peters in Manchester, with judges Gareth Malone, Michelle John and Harry Bradford. As a finale, all the choristers from the junior and senior heats join Aled to sing How Great Thou Art by Stuart K Hine

programme.title: Points of View
programme.desc: Viewers opinions on BBC shows and behind-the-scenes reports on new programmes

programme.title: Wallace and Gromit in The Curse of the Were-Rabbit
programme.desc: Inventor Wallace and his canine sidekick Gromit have set up a pest-control service, and are called in to stop rabbits overrunning a garden show. However, the pair are overwhelmed when a destructive giant bunny arrives on the scene, while an interfering aristocrat contrives to make matters worse. Nick Parks Oscar-winning animated adventure, with the voices of Peter Sallis, Ralph Fiennes and Helena Bonham Carter

programme.title: Planet Earth Live
programme.desc: Julia Bradbury and wildlife expert Lynn Rogers explore the Northwoods of Minnesota, following three black bear cubs and learning the dangers they face in the wild. The infant creatures are desirable prey for roaming coyotes and wolves, and combined with the threat posed by hunters and changeable weather conditions, their survival depends entirely on how well they learn skills from their mother

programme.title: Dynasties
programme.sub-title: Macaque: Monkeys in the Mountains - A Dynasties Special
programme.desc: Cameras follow leadership struggles among Barbary macaque monkeys in the Atlas Mountains of Morocco. The troops new alpha has successfully led the monkeys for a year through a drought and a frozen winter, but an error of judgment places his position in jeopardy. As mating season approaches, his allies start to turn against him, and a brutal attack sees him deposed, and banished from the group. However, the new leader proves far more aggressive, giving his ousted predecessor a chance to seize his position back. Narrated by David Attenborough

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: The latest forecast

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Charlotte Smith and Adam Henson visit Herefordshire during the apple harvest, and discover the various kinds of cider production to be found in the county. Plus, Tom Heap is out at sea with scientists investigating the impact of Britains rapidly expanding offshore windfarms on marine life

programme.title: Hamzas Hidden Wild Isles
programme.desc: Wildlife cameraman Hamza Yassin reveals hidden wildlife gems from across the British Isles. In the spring, he encounters badgers, adders and nightingales. Hamza also heads to the Wirral to try and film one of the weirdest events in Britain. A high spring tide forces small mammals to leave their homes in the marsh and head to higher ground, providing a frenzy for a range of predators

programme.title: Strictly Come Dancing
programme.desc: Tess Daly and Claudia Winkleman present as the two lowest-scoring duos go head to head in the second dance-off of the series - and if the panel cannot decide who to put through, the casting vote will now be shared weekly among all the judges. Adding to the fun, pianist Lang Lang performs a Disney classic and the professionals transform viewers to the Minecraft world

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents from Tarvit Mansion and Garden in Fife, Scotland. Finds include a painting by Jack Vettriano, a silver statue of Prince Albert and a haul of gold sovereigns. Fionas antiques knowledge is put to the test by Ceramics expert Will Farmer when he challenges her to work out where in the world three different Art Deco antiques were created.

programme.title: Riot Women
programme.desc: Sally Wainwrights drama about five women who find an escape from their chaotic lives by forming a punk band for a local talent contest. One member of the group is brought back from the brink of suicide by the offer, while a police officer finds that her latest arrest might be just the missing ingredient the band needs. Starring Tamsin Greig, Joanna Scanlan, Amelia Bullmore, Rosalie Craig and Lorraine Ashbourne

programme.title: Blackmailed: The Sextortion Killers
programme.desc: Reporter Tir Dhondy investigates the rise of sextortion scams targeting teenage boys on social media, including the case of 16-year-old victim Evan Boettler. Her journey leads to Nigeria, where she confronts the scammers taking part in these crimes. With unprecedented access and interviews with industry insiders, Tir exposes a disturbing online underworld and its devastating consequences

programme.title: The Womens Football Show
programme.desc: Highlights of the weekends games in the Super League, including Chelsea v Tottenham Hotspur, Arsenal v Brighton and Hove Albion and Liverpool v Manchester City

programme.title: The Graham Norton Show
programme.desc: Julia Roberts talks about her latest role in psychological campus drama After the Hunt. Colin Farrell discusses playing a con man and gambling addict in atmospheric thriller Ballad of a Small Player. Singer Gloria Estefan introduces her new Spanish-language album Raices. And Benedict Cumberbatch talks about playing a newly widowed father in The Thing with Feathers. Plus, Robbie Williams performs Pretty Face from the forthcoming album BRITPOP

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Gethin Jones and Helen Skelton present the weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical discussion and expert advice for viewers

programme.title: Crimewatch Live
programme.desc: Police appeal for information about allegations of past sexual abuse at a school, and the extraordinary story of the gang who stole a gold toilet from Blenheim Palace

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts is in Warwickshire to see a property above a former brewery, with a quirky layout and a holey roof. Dion Dublin heads to Staffordshire to visit a three-bed mid-terrace with a huge back garden boasting elevated views over Stoke-on-Trent. The programme also revisits a property in Nottinghamshire, where a couple bought a former farm building at auction to turn into their dream forever home

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Kate Bliss and Danny Sebastian assist the teams in Ardingly, while Natasha Raskin Sharp learns about a British furniture designer who crafted iconic designs from recycled materials

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: BBC Newsline; Weather
programme.desc: Local news worth watching from across Northern Ireland

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Trace, Track, Get My Car Back
programme.desc: Former police officer Ahron is tracking a stolen MG following a spate of car thefts in Leeds. He finds an illegal chop shop - but has the car already been broken up for parts?

programme.title: Lost and Found in the Lakes
programme.desc: Helen Skelton leads a team of experts searching for lost treasures around the Lake District and reunite them with previous owners. In the first episode, the team takes on a desperate search to find two beloved rings, and after a valuable find during an underwater search, social media detective Mui tries to track down the owner

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Sonali Shah helps a couple from Berkshire who are looking for a fresh start in a new home in the Herefordshire countryside, following a life-threatening, life-changing event

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Experts repair a Syrian rocking horse that has quite literally been through the wars, an ice cream trailer bought to sell gelato at weddings in the 1990s, a pocket dictionary that connects its owner to his late mother and a bell owned by the first ever female town crier for Lytham in Lancashire

programme.title: The Inner Circle
programme.desc: Amanda Holden hosts the quiz show where players must outsmart each other to win big. Six players are each randomly assigned a secret amount, which could be anything from zero to £4,000, before being thrown into a battle of wits, nerve and strategic gameplay across a series of challenging rounds

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong is joined by co-host Trevor Nelson on the quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Roman Kemp and Alex Jones present the first visit of the week to the One Show studio, featuring the usual mix of topical stories and celebrity chat

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: A worrying situation escalates in Albert Square and Teddy and Gina grow concerned for Harry

programme.title: Why Planes Crash
programme.desc: Documentary examining the reasons behind four plane crashes that occurred within a six-month period, resulting in a total of 506 deaths in a disastrous year for aviation. The programme examines a plane skidding off the runway in South Korea, a collision between a passenger plane and a military helicopter in Washington DC, a commuter jet rolling over on landing in Toronto, and an Air India plane crashing just seconds after take-off

programme.title: Blue Lights
programme.desc: Grace and Shane push boundaries for Lindsays sake as a threat closes in. Aisling and Tommy respond to a call-out where things are not as they seem, with unexpected consequences

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of todays headlines

programme.title: Stitched Up? Surgery in the Sun
programme.desc: Aoife Moore is in Istanbul with Chloe and her husband Chris, as Chloe undergoes for a boob job in a luxury five-star facility. She also reconnects with Martin, one of over 100,000 British and Irish patients who travel abroad each year for cosmetic dentistry

programme.title: Dreaming Whilst Black
programme.desc: Comedy, starring Adjani Salmon as a British-Jamaican film-maker facing the day-to-day struggles of being an independent creative trying to survive in London. Kwabena searches for his first directing job, but only finds scripts built on tired black stereotypes. With time running out, he considers whether to take any job or hold out for integrity. Comedy, starring Adjani Salmon, Dani Moseley and Demmy Ladipo

programme.title: Dreaming Whilst Black
programme.desc: Kwabenas long-awaited break comes with Sin and Subterfuge, a radical colour-blind Regency drama. What at first feels like a dream project soon raises unsettling questions and Kwabena tries to find a solution. A spark with talented actress comes at the worst possible time when an old flame resurfaces. Meanwhile, Funmi and Maurice sharpen their airs and graces in a bid to secure Mayowa a place at the boroughs top nursery. Comedy, starring Adjani Salmon

programme.title: Dreaming Whilst Black
programme.desc: Kwabenas first day on set finds him working with his hero, legendary actor Rudolph Williams. Determined to support the veteran performer, his good intentions are tested by the relentless demands of the shoot. To make matters worse, Vanessa weighs heavily on his mind, after their run-in brings up feelings he struggles to ignore. Maurice and Funmi are called in by the nursery after an altercation between Mayowa and another child, but are surprised to find things arent as they first assumed. Comedy, starring Adjani Salmon

programme.title: The Celebrity Inner Circle
programme.desc: Lawrence Chaney, Hannah Cockroft, Rick Edwards, Darren Harriott, Sarah Parish and Fay Ripley take part in the quiz show in which contestants and their celebrity partners must outsmart each other to win a cash prize. Hosted by Amanda Holden

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: The Mitchells join forces to support Callum, Harrys happiness is short-lived when a worrying situation comes to light, and Suki extends an olive branch

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Callum is forced to admit the truth, George inadvertently makes a situation worse, Teddy opts for a risky decision

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Phil is touched by Julies support, Suki receives unsolicited advice from her family as she prepares to make a decision, and Harry attempts to take matters into his own hands

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: An incident at Walford High sparks a heated debate among the Albert Square locals

programme.title: The Celebrity Traitors
programme.desc: Claudia Winkleman greets a group of celebrities as they arrive in the Scottish Highlands to play the ultimate reality game of detection, back-stabbing and trust. Once the traitors have been assigned, the famous faces find themselves questioning everything and everyone as they try to banish those who are working against them - before they become their first victim

programme.title: The Celebrity Traitors: Uncloaked
programme.desc: Ed Gamble catches up with the murdered and banished Players to get the scoop on all the backstabbing and treachery that goes on inside the castle. He also welcomes Players from series past to give their reactions and expert analysis on the game

programme.title: The Celebrity Traitors
programme.desc: As the game continues, the famous faithful realise the mission is not only high stakes, but could also hold important information in their hunt for the traitors. With the sun setting, the first round table commences, and emotions run high as the players suspicions are put to the test. Presented by Claudia Winkleman

programme.title: The Celebrity Traitors: Uncloaked
programme.desc: Ed Gamble is joined by banished and murdered celebrity players to discuss their time on the show - and to reveal the identity of the Traitors for the first time. Also, series three Traitor Linda and Faithful Frankie are on hand to help unpack all the latest castle drama

programme.title: Stranded on Honeymoon Island: Australia
programme.desc: On the sixth day on the islands, another crate washes up on shore which aims to help the couples move to the next level of intimacy. Drama unfolds for some of the newlyweds as the crate unearths deep insecurities and difficult questions

programme.title: Stranded on Honeymoon Island: Australia
programme.desc: As the couples hit a week stranded together, another orange crate with videos from the speed-dating event washes ashore. The videos prove to be a test of strength for each couple and an indication of jealous tendencies

programme.title: Stranded on Honeymoon Island: Australia
programme.desc: Halfway through their adventures, some relationships are flourishing while others teeter on the edge. The aftermath of Couples Cove casts a shadow and a message in a bottle ignites anticipation, prompting the couples to embark on unprecedented double dates

programme.title: Tommy: The Good. The Bad. The Fury
programme.desc: Tommy prepares for his first gym appearance since announcing his comeback, but with fighter Darren Till throwing threats and chaos into the mix, trainer John pulls Tommy out of the fight claiming he is unwilling to risk his sons future career. Its a crushing blow for Tommy, whos desperate for momentum and purpose. Amid the pressure, theres a flicker of hope - Tommy and partner Molly-Mae Hague are spotted together on New Years Eve, with a kiss that hints at a brighter future

programme.title: Horrible Histories
programme.desc: Mankinds most ingenious inventors are given the Horrible Histories treatment, as we take in everything from the invention of the wheel to the crisp

programme.title: The Catch Up
programme.desc: A round-up of the days news

programme.title: Match of the Day Live
programme.desc: Wales v Belgium (Kick-off 7.45pm). Catrin Heledd is joined by Ashley Williams, Rob Earnshaw and Joe Ledley to present coverage of the FIFA World Cup Group J qualifier, which takes place at Cardiff City Stadium. The reverse fixture at King Baudouin Stadium in Brussels in June produced a seven-goal thriller, as Craig Bellamys men fought back from 3-0 down after just 27 minutes to draw level with the Belgians in the second half, only for Kevin de Bruyne to score the winner two minutes from time, securing the points. With commentary by Simon Davies and Nia Jones

programme.title: Blackmailed: The Sextortion Killers
programme.desc: Reporter Tir Dhondy investigates the rise of sextortion scams targeting teenage boys on social media, including the case of 16-year-old victim Evan Boettler. Her journey leads to Nigeria, where she confronts the scammers taking part in these crimes. With unprecedented access and interviews with industry insiders, Tir exposes a disturbing online underworld and its devastating consequences

programme.title: Stranded on Honeymoon Island: Australia
programme.desc: The six newlywed couples are over halfway through their adventure. But the arrival of the flare and a way out of the experience makes waves for three couples who are facing major challenges. While some relationships reach new heights, one couple hits breaking point

programme.desc: Elder Panda is teaching Love Monster to fly a kite. Love Monster loves to watch it swish around in the air. Elder Panda goes off to get some froyo, which is perfect on Kite Day. Before he goes, he tells Love Monster that soon it will be time for him to go on to his next kiting challenge. Love Monster looks at all the other kites and sees the dragon kite, which is the largest kite of them all. Love Monsters small kite doesnt seem that exciting any more. He decides to try the dragon kite for just a minute. At first it seems easy, but then a wind gets it tangled in a tree. The rope breaks, and the kite flies off, causing mayhem in Fluffytown with everyone thinking it is a real dragon invasion. Finally, Elder Panda arrives and manages to bring it down to the ground using an umbrella, and Love Monster comes clean, saying how sorry he is. Elder Panda is disappointed but he does understand, as he too wanted to fly before he could run, but sometimes you have to start small before going big.

Nine-year-old stray westie called Norman gets much attention from mother and son Lorraine and Oliver - upsetting youngster Cynthia, a Staffie cross. Meanwhile, enthusiastic setter-poodle pup Obi might just win the chance to bring the joy and chaos that Mike and his partner Tracey dont yet know they need in their lives

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: This weeks competition begins at The Kings Head Inn in West Sussex. Owners Colin and Oonagh arrange a visit to a Second World War aviation museum

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: At The Roade House in Roade, Northamptonshire, hosts Paul and Maxine boast a wealth of facilities including a yoga studio and hair salon but guests discover a pressing problem

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The BandBers sample the great outdoors for the weeks final visit, at Sanath and Amelias Stamford Meadows Glamping in Lincolnshire. programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off

Finally, their skills are pushed to the limit with an intricately sculpted tart showstopper. Whose plaits will leave Paul Hollywood and Prue Leith tongue-tied? And whose pie will equal goodbye?

programme.title: Hotel Chocolat Unwrapped
programme.desc: Manager Aaron and his staff prepare for the opening of the companys new Thanet store, but some last-minute hitches threaten to scupper his plans. programme.title: Educating Yorkshire
programme.desc: The staff deal with the arrival of 191 new Year Seven pupils, including a girl who has lost the sight in one eye, and who faces the daunting prospect of her first reading test. An excitable boys excessive energy lands him in trouble, but Miss Nurse and Miss Healey suggest that a part in the school play might be a way to channel his enthusiasm

programme.title: Hunted
programme.desc: Social experiment in which 14 people are given fugitive status and go on the run, taking extreme measures to avoid detection as expert hunters track them down. The contenders must hit the ground running to make a daring escape from Stansted Airport and stay on the run for 21 days to win a share of £100,000 - but every move they make is tracked by facial recognition cameras

programme.title: Gogglebox

programme.title: 24 Hours in AandE
programme.desc: Three pedestrians are brought in to Queens Medical Centre following an incident in which a car mounted the pavement. The most injured patient, 18-year-old Mica, has suspected head injuries. A man is escalated to Resus as staff suspect that the 61-year-old may be having a stroke, while a 19-year-old student is admitted after cutting her leg on a night out

programme.title: In the Footsteps of Killers
programme.desc: The case of eight-year-old Vishal Mehrotra, who vanished while in central London in July 1981 while watching the wedding parade of Prince Charles and Lady Diana Spencer. Seven months later that his partial remains were discovered on an isolated farm in West Sussex. Emilia Fox, Professor David Wilson and Dr Graham Hill revisit a case that despite several police reviews over the last 41 years, has yet to identify the killer or killers

programme.title: Worlds Apart
programme.desc: Half a dozen young Britons who have never travelled alone are paired up with six pensioners who thought they would never travel again for the ultimate treasure hunt across Japan. The 12 strangers land in Tokyo, where they are paired up and set their challenge - track down the coins that could ultimately win them the prize of £50,000. But these unlikely pairs must overcome their differences if they are to stand a chance - and failure to work together means a one-way ticket home

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The chef takes on one of his toughest challenges yet, J Willys Bar and Grille in South Bend, Indiana, which has amassed debts of more than $1million. On finding an inexperienced chef serving food from both the freezer and tins, together with service that reduces one customer to tears, Gordon Ramsay orders an overnight deep-clean of the premises and designs a menu to inspire the kitchen staff

programme.title: The Simpsons

programme.title: The Simpsons

programme.title: The Simpsons

Caroline, however, loves their home, and particularly the neighbours who brought her, Chris and their teenagers comfort while she was undergoing cancer treatment

programme.title: The King of Queens
programme.desc: Doug and Carrie make new friends, but a scheduling error means they have to choose between going out with some old pals or their new acquaintances

programme.title: Dispatches
programme.desc: Undercover report from an overstretched 999 control room. With services facing a record level of demand, the programme reveals how patients face dangerous delays and having to choose between waiting for an ambulance or risking making their own way to hospital. Some callers are told an ambulance is being arranged when staff are actually deciding whether they need one. Targets are routinely missed. As winter approaches, Dispatches asks whether the Government is doing enough to fix the crisis in emergency care

programme.title: Portugal with Michael Portillo
programme.desc: Michael Portillos search for the real Portugal brings him to Sintra, once the playground of Portuguese royalty, until the end of the monarchy in 1910. Still a popular destination among tourists, its highlights include the 19th-century Pena Palace, the countrys icon of Romanticism, which borrows from medieval and Islamic architecture. Michael also explores the cobbled backstreets, finding a historic bakery and the two cakes for the which the town is renowned - a small cheesecake called a queijada and an almond-cream-filled puff-pastry known as a travesseiro

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay visits PJs Steakhouse in Queens, New York, to provide his expert advice to the owners. They decided to turn a successful bar into a high-end restaurant, but without any previous experience in managing a business they found themselves seriously in debt. With an over-confident chef and a partner propping up the bar, co-owner Madalyn faces a few difficult decisions

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads to Florida to help the owners of Fleming, a Danish restaurant in Miami. A husband-and-wife duo bought the business eight years ago in the hope of continuing the places success, but started losing money rapidly. With a Cuban chef cooking Nordic cuisine and a filthy kitchen, things go from bad to worse until it all comes to a head on relaunch night

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay visits Sushi Ko, a Japanese restaurant in California that is losing up to $20,000 a month. Gordon finds owner and chef Akira lacking in confidence and self-esteem as the strain of an empty business is beginning to take its toll on his relationship with this family

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay visits California, where his job is to help the owner of Lido Di Manhattan. Lisa Marie Hemmat, an ambitious business school graduate, has been running the restaurant for the past five years, but has failed to exert any control over the kitchen and the menu. The chef tries to teach her the basics of cooking and venue management, but trouble brews when her staff threaten to walk out on relaunch night

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads to Boca Raton in Florida to turn around the fortunes of Italian restaurant Anna Vincenzos. The owner opened the establishment in 2001 with the help of her father but the business has failed to meet her expectations, and the chef realises that her ruthless style of management is having an adverse influence, not only on her staff but also on her family

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: In Spring, Texas, Gordon Ramsay tries to revamp Kings Blu Jam Cafe, which specialises in breakfast, brunch and lunch. With debts mounting, the dynamic between owner Connie and her manager and daughter Justin is described by staff members as toxic and volatile, while miscommunications and an overwhelming menu are causing problems. Can Gordon turn things around and help repair the relationship between mother and daughter in the process?

programme.title: Taskmaster Bleeped
programme.desc: No-naughty-bits version. Alex Horne goes under the spotlight as a livid Maisie Adam objects to his actions in a task involving an obstacle course. Ania Magliano asks a stranger about their marital status, Sanjeev Bhaskar resorts to bribery, Phil Ellis strips to his base layer and Reece Shearsmith destroys a valuable ornament. Throughout it all, Greg Davies expertly maintains order with his usual stern authority. Exec Prods: Alex Horne, Richard Allen-Turner, Rob Aslett, Andy Devonshire, James Taylor, Jon Thoday; Series Prod: Andy Cartwright; Series Dir: Andy Devonshire; Prod Co: Avalon

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels between Liverpool and Wales. Along the way he discovers a childhood favourite - a miniature tank engine with three carriages in dark red - made by Frank Hornby, and learns the story of a Welsh countess who lived in Gwrych Castle. In Snowdonia, he also rides the waves with a Welsh surfing champion

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo explores a Swiss garden in Bedfordshire, drives a locomobile, and at Rothampsted, he discovers the Victorian origins of the fertiliser industry

programme.title: Barnacle Bill
programme.desc: The latest in a long line of seafarers tries to save a derelict Victorian pier from demolition by getting it registered as a vessel. Ealing comedy, starring Alec Guinness, Irene Browne, Maurice Denham and Lionel Jeffries

programme.title: The Borrowers
programme.desc: A family of four-inch-high people living beneath the floorboards of an ordinary human home help the owners son fight back when a dastardly lawyer plans to demolish the house and make way for a luxury apartment block. Childrens fantasy, starring John Goodman, Jim Broadbent, Celia Imrie, Flora Newbigin and Tom Felton

programme.title: Tooth Fairy
programme.desc: A minor-league ice hockey player is nicknamed the Tooth Fairy for knocking opponents teeth out on the ice. When the cynical athlete discourages a young fan, he is forced to pay penance by spending a week as the real Tooth Fairy, rediscovering his dreams in the process. Family comedy, starring Dwayne Johnson, Ashley Judd, Stephen Merchant, Ryan Sheckler and Seth MacFarlane

programme.title: Bridge of Spies Interview Special
programme.desc: Director Steven Spielberg and stars Tom Hanks and Mark Rylance talk about the making of the Cold War espionage drama

programme.title: Turner and Hooch
programme.desc: A Californian detective investigating the murder of a local man by drug smugglers has only one witness to help him solve the case - the large, smelly dog that belonged to the victim, which is about to turn the detectives well-ordered existence into chaos. Family comedy, starring Tom Hanks, Mare Winningham and Craig T Nelson

programme.title: Bumblebee
programme.desc: In 1987, lonely Californian teenager Charlie Watson is traumatised by the death of her father and resentful of her mother Sallys relationship with new boyfriend Ronald. For her 18th-birthday shes given a yellow Volkswagen Beetle, which turns out to be the battle-scarred Autobot Bumblebee. Transformers prequel, starring Hailee Steinfeld, John Cena and Jorge Lendeborg Jr

programme.title: Top Gun: Maverick
programme.desc: Pete Maverick Mitchell returns to the Top Gun Instructor programme, where he must confront his past as he trains a group of younger pilots for a deadly mission. Among them is the son of Mavericks deceased best friend, Lieutenant Nick Goose Bradshaw. Director Joseph Kosinskis Oscar-winning action drama, starring Tom Cruise, Jennifer Connelly, Miles Teller, Val Kilmer, Bashir Salahuddin and Glen Powell

programme.title: Infinite
programme.desc: A man who finds himself troubled by memories that are not his and developing skills he never learned is recruited by a mysterious organisation. The members of this group have learned to access the experiences of their past lives, but one has gone rogue, and must be stopped in his efforts to end the cycle of reincarnation by destroying all human life. Sci-fi thriller, starring Mark Wahlberg and Chiwetel Ejiofor

programme.title: Paranormal Activity: Next of Kin
programme.desc: Margot, a young woman who was abandoned by her mother as a baby, travels to a secluded Amish community with a documentary film crew seeking answers about her mother and extended family. Horror thriller, starring Emily Bader, Roland Buck III and Dan Lippert

programme.title: The 300 Spartans
programme.desc: The ruler of the Persian empire vows to expand his realm by conquering Greece. The king of Sparta steps forward to defend his homeland and the other kingdoms of Greece, but when he is betrayed by a political council, he finds himself without an army and must fend off the vast invading army with a mere 300 warriors. Historical drama, starring Richard Egan, Ralph Richardson and Diane Baker

programme.title: Henry VIII and His Six Wives
programme.desc: The Tudor monarch looks back on his tumultuous reign as he lies on his deathbed. He remembers the six women he made his queen, and how the series of unsuccessful marriages impacted on the political state of England and led to the downfall of some of his most trusted allies. Historical drama, starring Keith Michell, Donald Pleasence, Charlotte Rampling and Brian Blessed

programme.title: Ride Lonesome
programme.desc: A bounty hunter captures young killer Billy John, but his real motive is not the cash reward - he has an old score to settle with his prisoners brother Frank. As the journey to bring the murderer to justice gets under way, he is counting on a showdown with Frank and accepts the help of two outlaw gunmen for added protection, aware they will try to turn Billy John in themselves for the reward and a pardon. Western, with Randolph Scott, Lee Van Cleef, James Best, James Coburn and Pernell Roberts.

programme.title: Kind Hearts and Coronets
programme.desc: The penniless grandson of a duke plots to eliminate the eight relatives standing between him and a vast inheritance. He shoots, drowns, poisons and explodes his way through his family tree, but his final triumph is ruined when his lady loves husband kills himself. Ealing black comedy, starring Alec Guinness as all eight potential victims, with Dennis Price, Valerie Hobson and Joan Greenwood

programme.title: Land
programme.desc: Edee, in the aftermath of an unfathomable event, finds herself unable to stay connected to the world she once knew and in the face of that uncertainty, retreats to the magnificent but unforgiving wilds of the Rockies. After a local hunter brings her back from the brink of death, she must find a way to live again. Drama, directed by and starring Robin Wright, with Demián Bichir and Sarah Dawn Pledge

programme.title: The Great Wall
programme.desc: In the 11th century, a group of Europeans set out for China to discover how to make gunpowder. However, on arrival their claims to be on a trading mission are disbelieved and they are arrested and imprisoned by the Nameless Order within the Great Wall - just as it is about to be beset by giant, lizard-like monsters. As wave after wave of attacks and surprise tactics batter the Wall, Europeans and Chinese battle hordes of the creatures in a series of escalating conflicts leading to a final confrontation with the alien queen. Fantasy adventure, starring Matt Damon, Willem Dafoe and Tian Jing

programme.title: The Forever Purge
programme.desc: Members of an underground movement, no longer satisfied with the annual night of anarchy and murder, decide to take over the United States through an unending campaign of mayhem and massacre. On the morning after The Purge, a masked gang of killers attacks a wealthy Texas ranching family and their workers. Exposed by daylight, the two families are forced to band together and fight back as the country spirals into chaos and begins to disintegrate around them. Horror sequel, starring Ana de la Reguera

programme.title: Piggy
programme.desc: An overweight teen is bullied by a gang of cool girls while holidaying in her village. Horror, starring Laura Galan and Richard Holmes. In Spanish with English subtitles

programme.title: Switched for Christmas
programme.desc: Estranged twin sisters who are polar opposites reunite in the run-up to Christmas, one year after their mother died. Both are frustrated with their lives, and envious of the other. When the opportunity arises to swap places, they decide to give it a try until Christmas Day, and in the process they gain a new understanding of what they already have. Festive drama, starring Candace Cameron Bure in a dual role, with Eion Bailey

Carnegie and Catherine struggle to shake off Ken and Alun during their first date at the races, until their full attention is claimed when a jockey falls from his horse on the track. Robert Cavanah and Amelia Curtis star

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Sergeant Craddock is smitten by the charms of newcomer Susan Finlay, only to face a quandary when her son is charged with dangerous driving. Elsewhere, PC Bellamy rashly turns to the casino table and Vernon inadvertently causes chaos on a brides big day. Starring Philip Franks, Mark Jordon and Geoffrey Hughes

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Jackie prosecutes her mothers friend for negligence in the workplace, and Blaketon expresses his disapproval of Bellamys relationship with Gina in no uncertain terms. Vernon and David turn their talents to the celebrity catering industry - with spectacular results. Rural drama, starring Fiona Dolman, Michelle Holmes and Susan Jameson

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Eli takes Debbie for a drink, which leads to a liaison between the pair. Later on, when shes asleep, he takes the chance to steal the photo of his illicit kiss with Kelly.

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Scarlett finds out about the photo of Eli and Kelly, and Laurel continues her quest to transfer Emilys feelings for Ashley on to the Bishop.

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Hayley struggles to cope at Underworld and decides to ask for Carlas help, while Violet tells Sean she thinks they should sleep together. Lloyd catches Pat leaving Eileens house.

programme.title: Downton Abbey
programme.desc: The residents celebrate Christmas 1919 with a lavish party, but tensions are rife and Batess arrest casts a shadow over the festivities. Mary has to consider her future with Sir Richard Carlisle following a disagreement at a shoot and Violet has concerns about Rosamund, whose new suitor - the dashing but raffish Lord Hepworth - is not all he seems. One-off festive special of the hit costume drama, guest starring Nigel Havers and Sharon Small, with Brendan Coyle, Michelle Dockery, Iain Glen, Maggie Smith and Samantha Bond

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: An elderly farmers widow seems to be the victim of a hate campaign, and the police race to uncover the culprit as events take a more serious turn. Vernon Scripps burns rubber to win a bet, enlisting Bernies help in creating a hot-rod to rival the competition, and Ventress wonders if he should inform Bellamy after seeing Gina leaving the maternity ward. Drama, starring Jean Alexander and Geoffrey Hughes

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Vernon suffers delusions of grandeur while playing bodyguard to a Russian prince staying at Ashfordly Hall, leaving David to help Bellamy with preparations for a special VIP evening of his own. Elsewhere in Aidensfield, Mikes niece pays a visit, and proves to be a typical teenager by getting up to all sorts of mischief. Rural drama, starring Mark Jordon and Geoffrey Hughes

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: During a music masterclass led by a renowned pianist, a shy prodigy suffers a panic attack and runs off to a nearby river. To her horror, she witnesses a woman drowning and a baby left on the riverbank. But when Barnaby arrives, there is no sign of the victim - and he is struck by similarities to another mysterious case that happened 20 years ago at the same spot. Guest starring veteran actor James Fox and Coronation Streets Ian Puleston-Davies (Owen Armstrong), alongside former Corrie star Richard Fleeshman (Craig Harris)

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The local gossips go to town when a naked and mutilated corpse is discovered in the middle of a crop circle. However, their lurid tales of extraterrestrial abduction soon take a turn for the macabre when more similarly injured cadavers are discovered, causing DCI Barnaby to question his down-to-earth approach. Murder mystery, starring John Nettles

programme.desc: Tony wakes up in hospital after being hit on the head by a would-be murderer - and discovers he is suffering from a brain tumour that is dramatically affecting his behaviour. programme.title: Tutankhamun: Secrets of the Tomb
programme.desc: Part one of two. On 26th November 1922, Howard Carter made the greatest archaeological find of all time - the treasure-filled tomb of Egyptian boy king Tutankhamun. An unrivalled discovery made possible by Carters extraordinary tenacity and the dedicated financier by his side, Lord Carnarvon. But when people who entered the tomb began dying, tales spread of a Pharaohs Curse. In this first episode, paleo-anthropologist Ella Al-Shamahi begins to unravel the extraordinary scientific truth behind the legend and the press sensation that surrounded it for decades. As she travels from Tuts tomb in Egypts Valley of the Kings, to a shrine in Wawel cathedral in Krakow, Poland, the investigation links a series of mysterious deaths in both locations, each attributed to a curse. Ella unearths the truly deadly secret lurking in these tombs

Donatello (voiced by Micah Abbey), Leonardo (Nicolas Cantu), Michelangelo (Shamon Brown Jr) and Raphael (Brady Noon) experience the usual growing pains of teenagers while contending with the media spotlight. Building on their friendship with aspiring reporter April ONeil (Ayo Edebiri), the reptilian quartet face brilliant inventor Bishop (Alanna Ubach), who believes mutants are the greatest danger facing humankind and must be eliminated. Meanwhile, pampered rich kid Rod (Pete Davison) yearns to be a mutant and leverages his wealth and connections to achieve a dangerous dream

programme.desc: Comedian, presenter and actor Matt Lucas had an exceptionally close bond with his late grandmother, Margot, who came to the UK in 1939 as a Jewish refugee from Nazi Germany. Matt has never fully understood what Margot experienced as a young woman in Berlin in the lead up to the Second World War - or what became of the extended family she left behind. Matts poignant journey takes him to Berlin, and then to Amsterdam where he discovers an extraordinary connection to Anne Frank, as well as the fate of his many family members who had fled to Holland, which was later was invaded by the Germans

programme.title: Dog Squad
programme.desc: Newfoundland Sylvie is a big therapy dog with big soft cuddles who loves to help people when theyre worried. She and her owner Katrina visit all sorts of people every day, young and old. Sylvie has a bit of a sniffle, so Katrina makes an appointment for her to see the vet. Its usually Sylvies job to help others feel calm, but now she needs to help herself. Katrina always gets worried when Sylvie is poorly, so next she needs to calm Katrinas nerves. The vet gives her the all-clear, but in the waiting room a little girl called Dina is very worried about her cat, Mittens, who has had an accident. So Sylvie puts her harness on and supercharges her super heart.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Stevie places Faith on restricted duties after drugs are found to be missing from the ED. However, her authority as acting clinical lead is undermined when Faith refuses to let her search her locker and refuses to stay in triage when a patient attacks Sean. The team must pull together and carry on in the wake of a podcast revealing that Jodie had slept with Aaron after his wifes funeral

programme.title: RTÉ News: One OClock and Weather
Nevens Ulster Food Tour
programme.desc: Neven Maguire heads to Bundoran in Donegal to meet Irelands first professional surfer Richie Fitzgerald. They talk about the towns love of surfing and the strong influence it has had on Bundorans cafe culture. He also visits a family-run bakery on the edge of Laghey village, learns about hand-crafted gin in the Boatyard Distillery in Enniskillen and visits Belleek Pottery, where he has a go at creating and painting his own piece

programme.title: Seisiún
programme.desc: Muireann Nic Amhlaoibh presents music from The Spirit Store in Dundalk, featuring performances by singer-songwriter Jack Lukeman, the innovative group Shy Mascot and brothers Saran and Tadhg Mulligan on the fiddle and concertina. Muireann revamps a classic with accompaniment from renowned local musician Donal OConnor and the acclaimed post-punk band Gurriers perform their new release Erasure. Muireann also meets Derek Turner, the manager who has helped develop the portside venue from an old dockers pub

programme.title: Tracks and Trails
programme.desc: Veteran journalist and political commentator Tommie Gorman visits Tipperary to walk part of the ancient trail taken by St Declan. He starts in the market town of Cahir with a stroll around the castle, before setting off along the River Suir. Tommie stops off at Swiss Cottage and the ruins of Ladys Abbey along the way

programme.title: Nerves of Steel
programme.desc: Installation of the coasters tracks and trains begins, and the HR team kick off their recruitment drive to hire the extra staff needed for the Parks expansion. But persistent bad weather hampers progress on construction

programme.title: All Creatures Great and Small
programme.desc: James and Helen are keeping a secret, and following a visit to the Crabtrees Farm, Carmody is challenged with learning how to be a vet outside of his books. The new farmers have a worrying illness amongst their herd and James wants to help them in any way he can

programme.title: The Money List
programme.desc: Champions Dylan from Wexford and Monica from Cork take on Karen from Mayo and Lawrence from Cork. The winners face new challengers Ciarán from Offaly and Niamh from Limerick. Presented by Baz Ashmawy

programme.title: Showkids
programme.desc: Sam takes over an improv scene in Miss Jessops and Chloe accuses him of getting a big head. Zubi and the others try to help Tadhg through it, but once again, Sams big head takes over - and its about to explode

programme.title: The Walsh Sisters
programme.desc: This edition opens with a flashback, before cutting to the present - Anna in hospital, reeling from events of the incident and desperate for answers. Maggie tells Garv she wants to start IVF, but he brushes her off, reluctantly agreeing to a rigid sex schedule

programme.title: Mrs Browns Boys
programme.desc: Its Halloween in Finglas and everyone is getting into the spooky spirit of things. Agnes is ready for any trick-or-treaters, but instead receives a surprising visitor from her past. As no one else can see her ghostly guest, they think shes gone mad - not even Doctor Flynn can help. Luckily, Father Damien is on hand, and with a little help from Grandad, they get rid of the unwanted guest in time to head down to Foleys for the fancy dress shindig. A live special of the comedy, written by and starring Brendan OCarroll

In Taibo and Jauny, Simon encounters two gauchos, the cowboys of South America, who live isolated lives in the mountains, tending their livestock and braving the storms in a simple hut for months on end
