programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: It was 30 years after the Romans invaded Britain that they were ready to take on the challenge of conquering the Lake District. With the toughest landscape they had encountered in the nation, peopled by a rebellious tribe, it was no small task, but within a few years, the whole of Lakeland was under their control. Tony Robinson tackles the journey by himself, walking 50 miles from Penrith to Ambleside and on to the Irish Sea at Ravenglass, discovering that the Romans encountered beauty and danger in equal measure

programme.title: Digging for Britain
programme.sub-title: Ice Age Camp and a Saint with Syphilis
programme.desc: In Scotland and northern England, Alice Roberts investigates an Ice Age camp, a mysterious medieval skeleton and the earliest evidence of salt making in Britain

programme.title: Weird Britain
programme.desc: In Gloucestershire, Andy McGrath receives basic military training at a Civil War re-enactment, embarks upon a hunt in the creepy surroundings of Littledean Jail with paranormal researcher Jane, fights back against the spectre of old age at St Anthonys Well, and investigates the story of the last woman to be prosecuted for witchcraft in England

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: When a seller speeds into the shop with an iconic piece of Sammy Hagar memorabilia, Corey calls for back-up. Rick has a chance to buy a vintage whisky strap

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The work of staff at a pawn shop on the outskirts of Las Vegas, as they try to assess the true value of items brought in to their store

programme.title: Alone
programme.desc: The remaining survivalists make a final push to the finish line. One survivalist - desperate for food - finds promise in the local antelope, while another contends with the emotional burden of leaving their family. Only one can win the $500,000 prize and make series history as the first winner in a desert climate

programme.title: Kevin Costners The West
programme.desc: Cynthia Ann Parker, Naduah, Narua, or Preloch, was a woman who was captured, aged around nine, by a Comanche band during the Fort Parker massacre in 1836, in which several of her relatives were killed. The crime triggered a series of increasingly deadly confrontations between her Comanche captors and the newly independent Texas

programme.title: Britains Most Historic Towns
programme.desc: Alice Roberts explores Plymouths history during the Elizabethan era, visiting the home of the citys most famous son, Sir Francis Drake, and uncovering his history of piracy and slave trading - all carried out with approval from the Queen. She also discovers the revolutionary shipbuilding techniques that helped defeat the Spanish Armada, while aerial archaeologist Ben Robinson highlights the physical characteristics that made Plymouth Harbour such an attractive base for pirates

programme.title: Britains Most Historic Towns
programme.desc: Professor Alice Roberts is in Glasgow to investigate the impact of steam power on Britains major towns in the 18th and 19th centuries. She also learns about the arrival of migrant workers in the city and how the insanitary conditions in which they lived, which made Glasgow both a hotbed of disease and a place of great medical advancement. Aerial archaeologist Ben Robinson flies his drone over Loch Katrine as he tells the story of how Victorian engineers overcame geographical barriers to bring fresh drinking water to the workers of Glasgow

programme.title: Britains Most Historic Towns
programme.desc: Alice Roberts explores Edinburgh and its role in the union between England and Scotland. She discovers how the famous case of Burke and Hares bodysnatching influenced British medical law, and visits the Royal Bank of Scotland, where she uncovers evidence of the worlds first overdraft. Plus, the role played by Henry Dundas, whose statue stands in St Andrews Square, in the continuation of the slave trade

programme.title: Digging for Britain
programme.desc: Alice Roberts visits a secret location in the Cotswolds, which appears to be a high-status Anglo Saxon cemetery, where she finds a very precious and fragile artefact. A team from Cardiff University is called to the bone cave of Wales to investigate medieval bones protruding from a cliff face on the Welsh coast

programme.title: Digging for Britain
programme.desc: In Northern Ireland, the graveyard of a Victorian workhouse sheds light on one of the most traumatic periods of modern Irish history, the Great Famine of 1845. A team from Sheffield University want to understand the lives of people who occupied a village near the famous caves at Cresswell Crags in Nottinghamshire, and near Lincoln, a revisit to an Anglo Saxon site near proves rewarding

programme.title: Digging for Britain
programme.desc: How a lobster led archaeologists to the discovery of an 8,000-year-old neolithic settlement and witnessing the excavation of an Iron Age crouched burial at a secret location in Dorset. Also, Naoise Mac Sweeney visits a modern construction site as it gives up the secrets of an Elizabethan playhouse

programme.title: Digging for Britain
programme.desc: Alice Roberts seeks out the most outstanding archaeological digs of the year, beginning in the east of England. She witnesses the uncovering of a Roman mosaic found on farmland in Rutland, and visits the site of a saintly hermits hovel discovered in the Lincolnshire fens

programme.title: The Abyss: Rise and Fall of the Nazis
programme.desc: A fresh look at the Third Reich from a global and current perspective. This episode recalls how a social protest turned into a racist and anti-Jewish movement during the 1920s. The NSDAP deliberately used emotions to gain the loyalty of the people

programme.title: The Abyss: Rise and Fall of the Nazis
programme.desc: Events of 1933 and 1934 when President Hindenburg signed a decree in 1933 that suspended freedom of speech. It would be one of his last actions before his death from lung cancer. Also in this era, the first concentration camps for political opponents were set up

programme.title: Jack the Ripper: Written in Blood
programme.desc: Dramatised documentary exploring how the Whitechapel Murders fuelled the rise of tabloid journalism in Victorian Britain, highlighting how the press manipulated the story for its own gain, ultimately obstructing justice in the process. One Fleet Street newspaper in particular - the Star - shamelessly exploitated the killings to boost circulation and profits, hindering the police investigation to further its own agenda. With Moe Dunford, Chelsea Halfpenny, Tyger Drew-Honey and Mark Strepan

programme.title: Jack the Ripper: Written in Blood
programme.desc: With Whitechapel in panic, the Star incites violent anti-Semitic clashes, while the police struggle and the real murderer strikes again and again. At this stage, the moniker Leather Apron is used for the murderer by the press, prior to adopting Jack the Ripper. Moe Dunford, Chelsea Halfpenny, Tyger Drew-Honey and Mark Strepan star in this dramatised documentary

programme.title: Jack the Ripper: Written in Blood
programme.desc: Dramatised documentary exploring how the Whitechapel Murders fuelled the rise of tabloid journalism in Victorian Britain. The so-called From Hell letter sent with a preserved human kidney to the Whitechapel Vigilance Committee chairman George Lusk claimed to be from the killer, although the authenticity of the 1888 document is still debated. With Moe Dunford, Chelsea Halfpenny, Tyger Drew-Honey and Mark Strepan

programme.title: Historys Most Shocking

programme.desc: Lancaster Castle has witnessed scenes of historical, cultural and political significance throughout the centuries, including incidents of religious persecution, the trials of the Lancashire Witches and 200 public executions. Dan Jones explores its turbulent history and meets Wendy Robinson, a retired prosecutor from Australia, whose ancestors were sentenced to death at Lancaster Crown Court in 1817 for stealing sheep

programme.title: David Attenboroughs First Life
programme.desc: In the first of a two-part documentary, the naturalist explores the origins of life on Earth. Beginning the journey near his childhood home in Charnwood Forest, Leicestershire, he learns how a fossil discovery transformed scientists understanding of the evolution of complex organisms, and in Newfoundland and Australia he reveals the earliest kinds of animal to exist on the planet. With the help of cutting-edge technology and visual effects, the programme brings the creatures to life, demonstrating how they survived

programme.title: David Attenboroughs First Life
programme.desc: In the conclusion of the two-part documentary, the naturalist travels to Burgess Shale in Canadas Rocky Mountains, where he explores how evolution gained pace once creatures developed mouths and mobility. In Scotland, he reveals that one of the smallest fossils found holds the secret to how animals began surviving on dry land, and explains the bloom of life during the oxygen-rich Carboniferous period

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.sub-title: The Ziff Who Came to Dinner
programme.desc: Homer unwittingly takes the blame for his former love rival Artie Ziffs shady financial dealings and business irregularities. Arrested and put on trial, he is shocked to find himself sentenced to 10 years in prison. With the guest voice of Jon Lovitz

programme.title: David Attenboroughs First Life
programme.desc: In the first of a two-part documentary, the naturalist explores the origins of life on Earth. Beginning the journey near his childhood home in Charnwood Forest, Leicestershire, he learns how a fossil discovery transformed scientists understanding of the evolution of complex organisms, and in Newfoundland and Australia he reveals the earliest kinds of animal to exist on the planet. With the help of cutting-edge technology and visual effects, the programme brings the creatures to life, demonstrating how they survived

programme.title: David Attenboroughs First Life
programme.desc: In the conclusion of the two-part documentary, the naturalist travels to Burgess Shale in Canadas Rocky Mountains, where he explores how evolution gained pace once creatures developed mouths and mobility. In Scotland, he reveals that one of the smallest fossils found holds the secret to how animals began surviving on dry land, and explains the bloom of life during the oxygen-rich Carboniferous period

programme.title: Attenboroughs Journey
programme.desc: Documentary following David Attenborough as he journeys around the world to make his series First Life, which explores the origins of life on Earth. As he visits locations including the Great Barrier Reef, the deserts of Morocco and the glaciers of Canada, the broadcaster and wildlife expert explains his life-long fascination with the natural world, and also travels back to Leicestershire, the county in which he spent his childhood

programme.title: Rob and Romesh Vs

programme.title: S.W.A.T.

programme.title: Revival

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson heads to Italy to get behind the wheel of the exclusive, hand-crafted Alfa Romeo Disco Volante, which is made by coachbuilder Touring Superleggera and based on the manufacturers already rare 8C Competizione sports car. Richard Hammond asserts authority over the sand dunes of Abu Dhabi in the six-wheel-drive Mercedes-Benz G63 AMG 6x6, while James May defies his status as Captain Slow by blasting two Caterhams around the test track - the minimalist entry-level Seven 160 and the full-fat supercharged Seven 620R. Comedian Jack Whitehall sets a lap time in the Reasonably Priced Car

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Richard Hammond visits Abu Dhabis Yas Marina circuit to drive the Porsche 918 Spyder, a four-wheel-drive hybrid hypercar capable of astonishing speeds thanks to the 886 horsepower it can generate from its screaming V8 petrol engine and electric motors. Jeremy Clarkson and James May join forces to create a public information film to promote safer cycling, with their efforts presented to a panel of experts including members of Westminster Council and Olympic gold medal-winning rider Chris Boardman. Meanwhile, Jeremy - who has promised to change his name to Jennifer if the Porsche is faster around the test track than the McLaren P1 driven earlier in the series - compares the seventh-generation Volkswagen Golf GTI to BMWs critically acclaimed M135i. Breaking Bad star Aaron Paul fires up the Reasonably Priced Car to see what lap time he can achieve

It is one of the most beautiful and biodiverse corners of the words oceans and is crucial to the health of the wider marine environment, having been described as the Amazon of the seas

programme.title: The Bill

The sergeant is also struggling with family problems after learning he may be running out of time to reach a reconciliation with his estranged father

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: A man found beaten to death near his local turns out to be a widower with a drink problem, who has been neglecting his two children and spending a lot of time in the pub with the landlords attractive girlfriend (played by former EastEnders and Bad Girls actress Nicola Stapleton). Max returns to work following his run-in with Terry, but starts spreading rumours about a relationship between Grace and Neil, and it soon becomes clear he has not sorted out his drug problem

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: When a couple fail to turn up at the airport for a flight to Italy and their dog is found brutally killed in what appears to be a burglary at their home, suspicion falls on their son, who holds a grudge against his father for turning him in for possession of a class A drug. A neighbour produces mobile phone footage of the family car being torched by teenagers, one of whom is known to the police, and the case takes an unexpected twist when the Sun Hill team starts tracking the missing persons bank account. Former EastEnders actor Stuart Laing (Rob Minter) guest stars

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Kirsty calls for help when a woman is found unconscious and with multiple injuries beneath an open window. Callum eventually responds, having just learned of his fathers death, but as the investigation slowly uncovers the activities and relationships of the residents of the house, the sergeants distracted behaviour leads to a furious outburst against his colleague witnessed by Inspector Smith

programme.title: Home Fires
programme.desc: Pat and Marek are reconciled, but when someone sees them together, their relationship is in more danger than ever. The Brindsleys come to realise the full extent of Davids injuries, and Teresa faces letting go of the past when she is asked out. Alison fears the consequences of her involvement with the Lyons, Laura is spurred into action by some happy news, and Joyce and Erica work together on a first aid meeting

programme.title: Home Fires
programme.desc: The villagers prepare for harvest time, but Steph struggles to cope with the workload and faces losing the farm if she cannot meet her quota. A newcomer to the community stirs up tension between Sarah and Frances, while Joyce and the Brindsleys also receive unexpected visitors. Teresa faces a big decision, while Sarah finds herself in a dangerous situation. Alison discovers the real reason behind the parachute accidents and makes a horrifying connection to the factory. She races to warn Frances before it is too late

programme.title: Home Fires
programme.desc: The village prepares for Nick and Teresas wedding as the Battle of Britain draws to an end. Pat faces a big decision as Marek prepares to leave, but Bob intends to ruin her plans. Frances fights to clear her name following the closure of the factory, Alison wrestles with her conscience, and a chance encounter leaves Joyce with some unanswered questions

programme.title: Catherine Cooksons The Round Tower
programme.desc: Feature-length drama set in the 1950s, starring Emilia Fox as the rebellious teenage daughter of a successful businessman and his devoted wife, whose disenchantment with her privileged upbringing ultimately provokes a scandal in their small town. Keith Barron and Jan Harvey also star

programme.title: Last Tango in Halifax
programme.desc: Old friends Celia Dawson and Alan Buttershaw are both widowed and in their 70s, and have not seen each other for 60 years. When they are reunited over the internet and arrange to meet up, they discover it was an unfortunate twist of fate that prevented them getting together all those years ago. All at once, their feelings for each other are reignited and they make a snap decision. But when their daughters - buttoned-up headmistress Caroline and happy-go-lucky farmer Gillian - arrive at the pub to pick their parents up, how will they feel about becoming sisters-in-law? Sally Wainwrights light-hearted drama stars Derek Jacobi and Anne Reid as the second-time-around lovers, with Sarah Lancashire and Nicola Walker

programme.title: Sister Boniface Mysteries
programme.desc: Felix acts as a police adviser during the production of a bawdy film, on which the abrasive director is managing to rub everyone up the wrong way. Despite being incapacitated with a leg injury, Sister Boniface is called in to assist when a murder occurs on the set. Lorna Watson and Jerry Iwu star

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. There is little sympathy when child-killer James Wade dies in his cell, but Leos encounter with dying ex-prison inspector Rachel Kruger compels him to investigate the notorious Redhill jail - only to come up against a wall of silence. Meanwhile, Harry meets Wades sister Miriam and agrees to help find her brothers killer. Forensic crime drama, starring William Gaminara, Emilia Fox and Tom Ward, with Juliet Aubrey, Gillian Kearney and Jaye Griffiths

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The detectives investigate the kidnapping of two boys in 1979, which they believe could be linked to a recent spate of disappearances. The youngsters involved in the earlier case escaped - though their abductor was never found. Fearing they may be on the trail of a serial killer, the detectives also uncover a link with another unsolved case - the assault on a champion fisherman

programme.title: The Last Detective
programme.desc: Davies is saddened by the death of a harmless local tramp known for his penchant for collecting waste paper in a pram. The detectives instincts, along with the intervention of social services officer Jemma Duval, lead him to pursue the case, uncovering a wartime mystery along the way. Norman Wisdom stars alongside Peter Davison and Sean Hughes

programme.title: Spooks
programme.desc: Ruth is approached by an official council snooper claiming to have witnessed covert activity. She initially dismisses his claims, but on learning the man has applied to MI5 four times and been rejected owing to mental instability, she visits his flat to follow up the lead. However, she becomes embroiled in a dangerous situation linked to the death of a Mafia leader that Dimitri is investigating. Elsewhere, Lucas comes face to face with Harry in a confrontation destined to change Section D for ever

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: The roguish dealers daughter Vicki finds a ceremonial sword in the attic of her new flat that proves to have Scottish connections dating back to the era of Bonnie Prince Charlie. Lovejoy is approached by a man offering a generous sum for it, claiming a family connection. Later, after the item is subjected to a bungled burglary attempt investigations reveal it may hold the key to the location of buried treasure. Ian McShane stars

programme.title: The Upper Hand
programme.desc: An old friend visits Caroline and finds Charlie attractive. Comedy, starring Diana Weston and Joe McGann

programme.title: Terry and June
programme.desc: Terry looks after Tinas 12-year-old nephew, and finds himself having problems with graffiti and a childrens fancy-dress parade. Terry Scott stars

programme.title: Hotel Portofino
programme.desc: During the 1920s, Rose and her mother, Julia, arrive at an Italian hotel to evaluate a prospective marriage with Lucian, the war veteran son of the residences proprietors. But his mother, Bella, has more immediate worries - her most critical guest, Lady Latchmere, has fallen ill. Drama, starring Natascha McElhone and Louisa Binder

programme.desc: Steven is excited to win a part in a new play, but there are two problems - his arch-enemy Ray is also in it, and theres a rumour the director has a history of murdering difficult cast members. programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: The fly-on-the-wall documentary focuses on everyday situations in the neonatal ward, which treats one in 10 of the babies born at the maternity hospital. Parents anxiously await news of their twins, who were born 17 weeks premature, and a couple remain positive that one of their newborn triplets will soon be able to join his two brothers at home

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: A 19-year-old looks forward to becoming a mother after being told she might never get pregnant. Meanwhile, a woman who is terrified of needles dreads the prospect of undergoing an epidural, and a lesbian couple prepare for the birth of their second child

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: Fly-on-the-wall documentary observing the lives of staff at Princess Anne maternity hospital in Southampton, who - led by co-ordinator midwife Kay Duggan - help patients meet the challenges of becoming parents. In the first programme, two teenage sweethearts wait to meet their baby, and a woman who confesses to having a low pain threshold waits nervously with her husband

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: A couple who never dreamed of having children wait eagerly to meet their baby, and a mother-to-be is in high spirits until she hears screams from a nearby delivery room. Meanwhile, a woman invites her sister to join her at the birth, but she struggles to provide support when nausea strikes

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: A mother-to-be who thought she might never have children because she was born with a major heart defect waits for the arrival of her first child, and her partner is on hand to offer support when her spirits begin to flag. Meanwhile, a woman fears her labour could be a repeat of the previous one, which lasted several days

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: A father-to-be cannot be contacted as his girlfriends labour progresses, while another finds he has a crucial role to play when his wifes birth plans take an unexpected twist. Two women adopt different approaches to remaining calm and relieving the pressure of having a baby

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Noel Fitzpatrick treats a Persian cat that has been hit by a car, requiring treatments involving a skin graft and putting its crushed bones back together. Meanwhile, a rescue dog has a cancerous tumour in his jaw removed, and a young staffie-cross needs treatment for a developmental elbow disease

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: A 10-month-old puppy called Albie is knocked over by a car on a family camping holiday is rushed in as an emergency admission, and Noel Fitzpatrick fears this may be a life or death situation. Elsewhere, a Scottish terrier has a mysterious ailment, and a 16-month-old spaniel, is suffering from severe arthritis affecting both hips

programme.title: Inside the Ambulance
programme.desc: Boxing Day arrives and paramedics Deena Evans and Mike Hipgrave race to 71-year-old Frank, who has severe chest pains and has had difficulty breathing after going shopping

programme.title: Inside the Ambulance
programme.desc: Loz and Dave are called to a hotel where a young man has been struck down with abdominal pain, while Stu and Rob treat a man with breathing difficulties who has a detachable ear

programme.title: Inside the Operating Theatre
programme.desc: Dr Fox is in the visitors room for a change when his fiancee Sally has an operation to remove her wisdom teeth. Another patient has surgery to have a double hernia repaired

programme.title: Inside the Operating Theatre
programme.desc: One patient is flown home from holiday for an urgent operation to repair a detached retina, while another has a leaky vein that has caused an ulcer in his leg

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: Emma Bunton visits Southmead Hospital to support the maternity units charity, and her arrival causes quite a stir, with midwife Sacha bringing in some treasured Spice Girls memorabilia to get signed. Meanwhile, expectant mum Tina must decide whether she has a future with her partner, and Sarahs labour progresses quickly, but she cant get in touch with her husband. Catherine and Phillip, who met online, eagerly await the start of their family life together

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: Sooze found the birth of her first baby easy and confidently arrives at Southmead with her husband Joe, but the contractions quickly get the better of her. Teri and Merv, who are about to have their fourth child, talk about the cravings Teri has experienced this time round, while Becki and Ian nervously await their new arrival, having finally committed to each other following an on-off romance

programme.title: Interior Design Masters with Alan Carr
programme.desc: The contestants pair up to redesign cafes in the seaside town of Margate, with each person responsible for their own zone. One team decide that art deco is the way to go and choose a very bold colour palette, inspired by one of Margates most famous artists, JW Turner. The other team channel the colours of the sea with cool blues and vintage shutters to create a laid-back feel. But which one will impress Michelle Ogundehin and guest judge Ross Bailey the most? Presented by Alan Carr

programme.title: Inside the Ambulance
programme.desc: Join the crews in Dudley as V and Ollie are faced with a dilemma when they are called to woman who has suffered a seizure but refuses to go to hospital

programme.title: Nick Knowles Big House Clearout
programme.desc: In Lowestoft, Suffolk, the host meets a family of four who are being overwhelmed by a mountain of memories. Mum Cheryl lives with her partner, Robert, and her daughters, Tia and Cerys. After a tough few years following a divorce and bereavements, Cheryl finds it impossible to throw things away. Nick offers to clear out half of their unwanted belongings in return for a home makeover

programme.desc: High school sweethearts Mike and Ashley buy Ashleys childhood home hoping to raise a family there, but want to put their own touches on the familiar abode

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: Nick Knowles, his team and a group of volunteers are in Monmouth, Wales, to transform the family home of Charlotte, a mother recovering from a stroke that left her with brain damage, speech loss and partial paralysis. The current layout of her home makes it difficult for Charlotte to move around and have her physiotherapy treatment, so the team redesign the house to make things easier for her, her husband Rob and their children

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: Nick Knowles travels to the Isle of Sheppey in Kent to meet two extraordinary dads, Garry and Kyle, who have adopted four vulnerable children - three of whom have special needs - to give them the best life possible. But their cramped three-bedroom bungalow is making family life difficult. So to give this family the space they so desperately need, the DIY SOS builders are undertaking their most ambitious project yet - to demolish the bungalow and build a bespoke five-bedroom house in its place. But with just nine days to complete the task, it looks like being their toughest one yet

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: Nick Knowles meets midwife and kidney patient Sascha, who has to undergo intense dialysis sessions for hours on end, five days a week. This places the mother-of-fours body under great stress and the constant threat of blood clots gives her a life expectancy of just a few years. Determined to help, the DIY SOS team, bolstered by the local tradespeople and volunteers of Welwyn Garden City, renovate her home to include a dedicated dialysis room, offering her the chance of many more years with her family

programme.title: MasterChef Australia
programme.desc: The remaining contestants receive a heartfelt letter from home and must win the judges over by creating a deeply personal dish

programme.title: Inside the Ambulance
programme.desc: The paramedics of the West Midlands Ambulance Service are dispatched to help a woman who has had a seizure while in the shower

programme.title: Pete Wicks: For Dogs Sake
programme.desc: Strictly Come Dancing and TOWIE star Pete Wicks immerses himself in the heart-warming and emotional world of dog care at Basildons Dogs Trust rehoming centre. Pete returns to Dogs Trust, facing a suitcase of abandoned pups on day one and falling hard for Theo, a gentle Italian Mastiff with a serious heart condition.

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Noel Fitzpatrick faces one of his greatest practical and ethical challenges yet when hes introduced to Hermes, a tortoise with only one good leg. Can he provide Hermes with three prosthetic feet, using tiny titanium implants? Meanwhile, a rottweiler called Dave urgently needs an upgrade to his previous hip replacements

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: A small cavachon is rushed to see Professor Noel Fitzpatrick after being hit by a car. She has a broken leg, but also a serious heart condition. Meanwhile, Simba, a one-year-old Labrador needs help with her badly formed hips, and Tulee the nervous basset hound has diseased discs in her back that leave her in constant pain

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: Catherine and Simon went through years of fertility treatment to have their first son, which took a toll on their love life, but five years later, awaiting an elective C-section for their second baby, its a different story - a spontaneous romantic evening resulted in an unexpected positive pregnancy test. Heather ran into complications during her first pregnancy and had to deliver twins at 24 weeks. They pulled through, but cerebral palsy and other issues have meant she is now a full-time carer to them both. She also has Alfie, and after he was born, she and partner Dan decided they would have a fourth child to give him a companion to help share the responsibility of siblings with a disability. Christian couple Naomi and Dan tied the knot young and had their first child 13 months ago. Now, theyre back at Southmead for baby number two

programme.title: Interior Design Masters with Alan Carr
programme.desc: The three semi-finalists upgrade lakeside holiday lodges in the heart of the Cotswolds, each of which includes an open-plan kitchen, living and dining space and an outside terrace. The buildings are decidedly beige, giving the designers a blank canvas to work on - and knowing they are only one week away from the final they really go to town, with schemes ranging from bold primary colours inspired by a classic 1980s movie to a sophisticated monochrome look. Michelle Ogundehin judges their efforts with help from designer Abigail Ahern

programme.title: Inside the Ambulance
programme.desc: Paramedics blue light it to a man who had a bad fall and has a suspected spinal injury, while Ash and Craig help a 12-year-old boy who has been attacked at his local fun fair

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo reaches Colorado, where he follows in the footsteps of 19th-century east coast men who came to experience the cowboy life. At Bents Old Fort, he is transported back to the Mexican American War of 1848 and finds himself inspecting the troops, before heading out into the spectacular gorge of the Arkansas River aboard the historic narrow gauge Royal Gorge Railroad

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.sub-title: Santa Fe, New Mexico, to the Grand Canyon
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels through New Mexico, watching rehearsals at the Santa Fe Opera House and learning about a Lancashire railroad caterer who made his fortune. He then sets off from Albuquerque to pick up Arizonas Grand Canyon Railway as heads off to witness one of the greatest sights on Earth

programme.title: Great Indian Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels from Jodhpur to Delhi, heading into the desert to take a camel ride to a village where life has changed little in centuries, before embarking on the Jaipur-Agra-Delhi Golden Triangle tour - Indias must-do itinerary in 1913 as today. Michael also visits Agra, where he learns how the Taj Mahal, built by a Mughal emperor, was restored by a British viceroy at the time of his Bradshaws guide book

programme.title: Trawlermen
programme.desc: Seventeen-year-old Ryan tries his hand at offshore fishing on board Ryanwood - one of a pair of the most successful trawlers in Britain. However, he is forced to battle seasickness and knows that if he does not knuckle down to work, skipper Kevin West will not be asking him to join them again

programme.title: Trawlermen
programme.desc: Prawn boat Amitys engines are on the brink of failing, and skipper Jimmy Buchan has to decide whether to cut loose the £30,000 nets to ensure a safe return to port. Meanwhile, newcomer Ryan Morrison tries to impress his boss on a trawler with a reputation for success

programme.title: Trawlermen
programme.desc: Prawn boat Amity gets caught in a winter storm 100 miles from shore, and is in danger of sinking while its nets are stuck on the seabed. Elsewhere, a rival trawler with a young skipper and crew is having great success. Series following the lives of Peterhead fishermen working in the North Sea

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek, with help from the Mathewson clan, drags a mini pickup out of the barn where its been for 20 years, and a 350cc Douglas Mark V motorbike from 1950 goes under the hammer

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Four VW camper vans pitch up at the auction house looking for a new home and Derek picks up an Austin 16 that goes like stink and has some unusual modern modifications

programme.title: Bangers and Cash: Restoring Classics
programme.desc: Derek points the team towards one of his favourite motors - a 1983 Daimler Double Six. And a Triumph 2000 is given a modern day makeover under the bonnet

programme.title: Flipping Bangers
programme.desc: British car enthusiasts Will and Gus buy a Porsche 923 with a cracked interior, bad paintwork and ripped seats. This driving legend is well past its best, but they still hope to turn a profit

programme.title: Frozen Planet
programme.desc: David Attenborough examines how the arrival of winter sparks a ruthless battle for survival in the polar regions, with temperatures plummeting to -70C, winds reaching 120mph and day-long darkness. As a blizzard rages, a polar bear treks into the Arctic mountains to give birth, while the entire world population of spectacled eider braves the weather in a giant ice hole. Wolves and bison engage in battle, but alliances are also made, and beneath the snow, voles try to dodge the attacks of great grey owls and weasels

programme.title: Frozen Planet
programme.desc: David Attenborough explores the life and work of people in the polar regions, including the residents of Norilsk in Siberia, the coldest city on Earth. He also discovers how the Danish armed forces maintain their countrys claim to Greenlands natural resources by mounting a 2,000-mile dog sled patrol during the winter, and finds out how a research base at the South Pole is able to cope with being cut off from the outside world for six months at a time

programme.title: Life
programme.desc: David Attenborough narrates this series exploring extreme behaviour in the natural world, uncovering some of the strategies animals have developed to stay alive and to breed, from Komodo dragons tackling buffalo to the courtship battle of the humpback whale. He begins by focusing on the methods used by creatures such as cheetahs, bottle-nosed dolphins and Venus fly-traps in their fights for survival

programme.title: Life
programme.desc: David Attenborough reveals how reptiles and amphibians, including the pebble toad and Jesus Christ lizard, conquer their shortcomings by using tricks and strategies to avoid predators. He also explores how chameleons can achieve a high level of accuracy with their muscle-propelled, extendible tongues, and finds out how a 9ft-long Komodo dragon can bring down a huge water buffalo

programme.title: Ireland with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: Part two of two. The second leg of Simons journey begins at the Giants Causeway, before visiting a kelp farm on Rathlin Island. He heads to the Dark Hedges in Co Antrim, one of the filming locations from Game of Thrones, and visits Belfast for the July 12 parades, discovering how the event has divided the city. He also learns more about Oliver Cromwells influence on Ireland, attends the Gaze film festival, and meets monkeys at an animal sanctuary in the Wicklow mountains

programme.title: Flipping Bangers
programme.desc: British car enthusiasts Will and Gus buy a Porsche 923 with a cracked interior, bad paintwork and ripped seats. This driving legend is well past its best, but they still hope to turn a profit

programme.title: Bangers and Cash: Restoring Classics
programme.desc: Derek points the team towards one of his favourite motors - a 1983 Daimler Double Six. And a Triumph 2000 is given a modern day makeover under the bonnet

programme.title: Bangers and Cash: Restoring Classics
programme.desc: Can the team finally smell profit when they sniff out a bargain Porsche? A DIY job on a Fiat should also keep the accountant happy but will it go to plan?

programme.title: Bangers and Cash: Restoring Classics
programme.desc: The teams first purchase is a 1972 VW Fastback, and the second project sees them pick up a 40-year-old police bike

programme.title: Bangers and Cash: Restoring Classics
programme.desc: The team cannot believe their luck when a Volvo 144 rolls in with just 15,000 miles on the clock

programme.title: Bangers and Cash: Restoring Classics
programme.desc: The team fall for a Subaru Pick-up, which has all the Mathewsons in agreement. But will it all come crashing down when picking up parts proves tricky?

programme.title: Bangers and Cash: Restoring Classics
programme.desc: A 1973 Ford Escort Mexico is the teams most expensive purchase to date. To save some cash Derek helps on their second buy - a 1968 Riley Kestrel

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels through Minneapolis and St Paul, where he learns how the power of the Mississippi helped Minneapolis become a great industrial centre. Later in St Paul, he explores the birthplace of F Scott Fitzgerald, and meets with a Native American expert to discover more about a dark chapter in American history

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his rail journey along the Upper Mississippi to Red Wing, Minnesota, and the home of Laura Ingalls Wilder, author of Little House on the Prairie. Picking up the Empire Builder rail service he travels to Winona, where he finds out how, in the 19th century, the US Army Corps of Engineers made the Mississippi navigable and how the river is maintained today

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek goes to pick up a veteran 1904 Swift, theres an emotional farewell to a 1980s Bedford HA van, and a Toyota Corona finds a new home

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek gives the once-over to a Royale Formula Ford race car, and Paul is on a marathon trip to Teesside to pick up a 1953 MGYB, a Moggy Van and an 80s Yamaha 250RD motorbike

programme.desc: The Spanish island of Villa Winter, which was suspected of being a port for German U-boats and part of a larger plan to invade the United States

programme.title: Nazi Hunters
programme.desc: A look at how British-trained Czechs were behind the assassination of Reinhard Heydrich, one of the main architects of the Holocaust

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the show from Arley Hall and Gardens in Cheshire, where a time capsule that has been buried for 130 years is opened for the first time on camera. Other finds brought in include a gold bracelet with a tragic past that was found bricked up behind a wall, and a lost work by 19th-century artist Lawrence Alma-Tadema

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce returns to the gardens of the Arley Hall, Cheshire, where a selection of family treasures come under scrutiny. Among the items brought in to be valued are a portrait painted in India in the 1950s, which expert Amin Jaffer identifies as the work of an acclaimed artist whose paintings have become much sought after in recent years, while other finds include a PoWs diary written while building the bridge over the River Kwai and a collection of gems once worn by a duchess

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: There is a triple collection of desirable cars in store for Derek when an MG Midget, an Austin-Healey frogeye Sprite and an RS2000 come up for auction

programme.title: Operation Arctic
programme.desc: The team presents more news from the remote Canadian town of Churchill on the edge of the Arctic. Kate Humble meets the Inuit artists inspired by the changing world around them, and Gordon Buchanan finds out how the townsfolk deal with the more troublesome bears when he follows the eviction of a repeat offender. Plus, a live report from the tundra on how the bears are getting on

programme.title: Indian Ocean with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: The adventurer reaches Sri Lanka, whose strategic location and tropical spices made it a target for invaders and colonisers for centuries. In the north he visits the scenes of vicious battles between the Tamil minority and the Sri Lankan army, traumatic events from which the population is still recovering. On his way to Bangladesh, he hitches a ride on a trawler, highlighting one of the Indian Oceans fastest-growing industries - providing prawns for the West. But as he reveals, it comes at a price for the environment

programme.title: The Lakes with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: The adventurer explores the impact of humans on the Lake District, discovering that the high number of visitors to Scafell Pike is damaging Englands highest peak and stretching the resources of mountain rescue volunteers. He goes wild swimming in the crystal clear lake of Buttermere, before taking a look at the less-fortunate Derwent Water, one of the many lakes now clogged with invasive New Zealand pygmyweed

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo takes in Georgia and Azerbaijan as he journeys through the former Russian empire. He begins in the port of Batumi, discovers a surprise 19th-century tea plantation in the West Georgian countryside, visits a private museum dedicated to Joseph Stalin - the most infamous Georgian of all - and discovers that a Briton was the first to conquer the highest mountain in the Caucasus range. Arriving in Azerbaijan, he learns about its role in the 19th-century oil industry

With Dawn French, Russ Abbot, Geraldine Chaplin, Phil Davis and Sarah Parish

programme.title: The Salvage Squad
programme.desc: Brian Dowling and his fashion-forward design team continue their mission to prove to the nation that it is possible achieve a dream home renovation at little cost. Changing Rooms meets the Repair Shop with a new sustainable twist, the challenge here is to transform our bland old rooms, furniture and fittings into unique and stunning show stoppers, using only upcycling and sustainable methods. This is the home makeover format for the world we live in today, as two households per week, each with a team consisting of an interior designer and an up-cycling wiz, have just four days and 1,000 euro to renovate and rejuvenate a tired spaces in their home, filling them with home-made, re-used and revamped furnishings. programme.title: Year Of
programme.desc: The school community pulls together in the wake of a tragic event, as friendships are threatened by competing perspectives on what happened

programme.title: Schitts Creek

programme.desc: Johnny and Moira go to Rolands annual Hawaiian party, Alexis and Ted host a couples dinner party, and David and Stevies relationship heats up

programme.title: Whos Doing the Dishes?
programme.desc: Brian McFadden is at the home of pop star and actor Adam Rickitt as he plays host to four strangers in his home. Will Adam avoid the washing up with his cryptic clues as to his identity or will the four diners bag the cash prize and hand the rubber gloves to him?

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.desc: Documentary going behind the scenes of the airport, finding out how its infrastructure helps staff process thousands of passengers arriving from 84 countries. programme.desc: Hosted by Anne Hegerty, this new quiz show sees sixteen families from across the country take part in a knock-out tournament to win the coveted title of Britains Brightest Family, and a holiday of a life time. The contestants go up against each other to answer a series of questions involving literacy, numeracy, problem-solving and general knowledge skills, with each team nominating a family member to answer the questions, proving how well they all know each others strengths and weaknesses

programme.title: European Qualifiers for FIFA World Cup Live
programme.desc: Denmark v Greece (Kick-off 7.45pm). Coverage of the Group C match at Parken Stadium, Copenhagen, as the teams meet for the second time. Denmark claimed a 3-0 victory in the reverse fixture last month, with goals scored by Mikkel Damsgaard, Andreas Christensen, and Rasmus Højlund

programme.title: European Qualifiers for FIFA World Cup Live
programme.desc: Northern Ireland v Germany (Kick-off 7.45pm). Coverage of the Group A match at Windsor Park. Isaac Prices equaliser in Cologne gave Northern Ireland hope of earning a result in the reverse fixture, but Germanys quality eventually shone through as they claimed a 3-1 win, with Florian Wirtz sealing the visitors fate with an excellent free-kick. However, the Germans 2-0 defeat at the hands of Slovakia in their opener shows that they are not infallible on their travels, and Michael ONeills men will be looking for what would be one of their most famous qualifying victories as they continue their bid to reach their first World Cup finals since 1986

programme.desc: A look inside the joyous, complicated and messy world of secondary school education. Filmed over an academic year, this documentary follows the students navigating the most formative years of their lives.
